metadata.synopsis: The Warden is a devout follower of the Absolute with an iron will, but also a sense of mischief. When the player approaches, she sees it as an opportunity to play with the player a little bit - like a cat with a mouse.
metadata.how_to_trigger: from tutorialDebug book → Go to Region → Act 2 → SCL → Entry Point Mountain Passteleport S_MOO_PrisonWardenSpeak to her.

18.speaker: The Warden
18.text: You. Not you. Lord Ketheric may think you pose no threat to him in your disgrace, but I know the things you've done.

127.speaker: The Warden
127.text: Keep your bloody thoughts to yourself and your head down.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: How in the Hells do you know me?

117.speaker: The Warden
117.text: You set foot in our tower once. You did not leave, at least not through any door I have watch over.

90.speaker: The Warden
90.text: I assumed you overstayed your welcome. Little did I expect you to intrude again.

32.speaker: The Warden
32.text: Your name, your place was kept from all of us last time, but you were to be shown the utmost of respect.

136.speaker: The Warden
136.text: Respect you must have proven yourself unworthy of. And now you waste my time.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Please, you have to help me, I really don't know what's going on.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Oh, don't mind me. My brain is all but mincemeat - I'm harmless now!

9.speaker: The Warden
9.text: You have the same black-tongued sense of humour as ever, I don't believe you for a heartbeat.

113.speaker: The Warden
113.text: A fool, perhaps, but a dangerous fool.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Whatever happened in the past is irrelevant now.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: You're going to tell me everything you know.

33.speaker: The Warden
33.text: The floor is yours, but stay your tongue. Do not speak to those behind bars.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I overheard the gnomes planning an escape.

76.speaker: The Warden
76.text: I know. We all know. Their 'whispers' are as subtle as a knife in the ear.

81.speaker: The Warden
81.text: Little good it'll do - no lockpick can breach the Absolute's domain. But watching them try is almost endearing.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: You know, you should go check on them - just in case.

149.speaker: The Warden
149.text: A fair point. And they should remember who decides their fate - it will do them good.
149.context: NodeContext: pleased with the idea and malicious

151.speaker: The Warden
151.text: No need. The scrying eyes are keeping watch, and my patrols can handle gnomes.
151.context: NodeContext: mocking - particularly on gnomes. She thinks they're pathetic

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You're not going to stop them?

19.speaker: The Warden
19.text: Why tame a wild horse when it's so close to breaking its own spirit?

60.speaker: The Warden
60.text: They're not leaving here alive - let them learn it the hard way.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I can take care of them, if you wish.

26.speaker: The Warden
26.text: No need. Once they realise escape is impossible, the Absolute will extend Her hand - and they will accept.

108.speaker: The Warden
108.text: Let them think they chose their fate - it is better, I find.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You don't look very busy to me.

74.speaker: The Warden
74.text: That makes sense, True Soul - you clearly don't know the meaning of the word.
74.context: NodeContext: a smile as she insults th eplayer

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I heard you the first time.

137.speaker: The Warden
137.text: Careful. You may be a True Soul, but I will not hesitate to enforce Her will.
137.context: NodeContext: smile as she threatens the player

35.speaker: The Warden
35.text: You spark of the familiar. Do I know you, True Soul?
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking over the player with a curious glance

158.speaker: The Warden
158.text: Hm. Perhaps not - your face is rather bland.

133.speaker: The Warden
133.text: Whatever your business, a warning: none may speak to the prisoners - Disciple Balthazar was most clear.
133.context: NodeContext: Dismissive expecting the player to leave now

62.speaker: Player
62.text: The rules don't apply to me.

82.speaker: The Warden
82.text: Is that so? If you are above the General's chief advisor, you must be most impressive.
82.context: NodeContext: Toying with the player, a little smirk - she thinks the player is an idiot.

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *Her smirk hides her intent - she's toying with you.*

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I'm not here to play games - I need to speak to the prisoners. Now.

104.speaker: The Warden
104.text: That tone might work on swaddled babes and puppies, but I am neither, True Soul.
104.context: NodeContext: playful smirk - the player just tried to stand up to her, and she finds it most amusing.

67.speaker: The Warden
67.text: I didn't know he had such... refined taste.
67.context: NodeContext: Looking at player - sarcasm. She's completely unimpressed with them.

141.speaker: The Warden
141.text: I'm not sure why someone of your stature must converse with prisoners. Perhaps a small donation would convince me.
141.context: NodeContext: playful smirk - you're actually planning to rob the player. Pause on 'convince' as she smiles

56.speaker: The Warden
56.text: Pockets running a little empty, are they?

150.speaker: The Warden
150.text: Disciple Balthazar's orders still stand - none may speak to the prisoners. You can go now.

123.speaker: The Warden
123.text: I'm afraid none, no matter how generous, may speak to the prisoners.
123.context: NodeContext: Smug and smirking - you've just taken the players gold and you're not giving it back

126.speaker: The Warden
126.text: The Absolute thanks you for this generous donation, True Soul. You can go now.
126.context: NodeContext: dismissive and also very pleased with yourself

27.speaker: Player
27.text: You thief - give me back my gold.

34.speaker: The Warden
34.context: NodeContext: mocking shrug. She has the gold but is pretending otherwise

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I should have seen that coming.

7.speaker: The Warden
7.context: NodeContext: mocking shrug. She has the gold but is pretending otherwise

40.speaker: The Warden
40.text: Move along, True Soul - have a pleasant day.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: That was so well-played, I'm not even mad.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: I could kill you, you know.

78.speaker: The Warden
78.text: Please try - I could use a laugh.

49.speaker: The Warden
49.text: Pity - I was about to grant you an exception.

120.speaker: The Warden
120.context: NodeContext: Don't believe the player - bored sarcasm.

73.speaker: The Warden
73.context: NodeContext: She's completely unimpressed with them.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Z'rell herself has entrusted me with an important mission.

138.speaker: The Warden
138.text: I didn't know we were so hard-pressed for staff.
138.context: NodeContext: Looking player over - completely unimpressed.

112.speaker: The Warden
112.text: I didn't know setting fire to trees was so admirable.
112.context: NodeContext: Looking player over - completely unimpressed.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Not as impressive as you. It is rare to find someone so singularly devoted to a task.

115.speaker: The Warden
115.text: I'm glad to be recognised by someone of such... staggering repute.
115.context: NodeContext: playful, lightly mocking the player

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I'm a master of stealth and subterfuge.

4.speaker: The Warden
4.text: A pity I am in no mood for hide-and-seek.
4.context: NodeContext: Looking player over - completely unimpressed.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I am the fiercest warrior you'll ever meet. My enemies shake when they hear my roar.

37.speaker: The Warden
37.text: Have you considered they might be shaking from laughter? Just a thought.
37.context: NodeContext: playful smirk as she looks the player over - mocking them

134.speaker: Player
134.text: You should see me in a fight - I can transform into powerful beasts from across the realms.

96.speaker: The Warden
96.text: Kindly keep your fur and faeces to yourself.
96.context: NodeContext: Looking player over - completely unimpressed.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Arcana runs through my veins - I am a sorcerer.

77.speaker: The Warden
77.text: That sounds like a venereal disease.
77.context: NodeContext: Looking player over - completely unimpressed.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I am a wizard - an expert in magic and all its mysteries.

43.speaker: The Warden
43.context: NodeContext: Looking player over - completely unimpressed.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I am a paladin - my word is my bond. I have good reason to speak to the prisoners, I swear it.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I could regale you with tales of my daring deeds - and there are many. But I really must speak to the prisoners.

145.speaker: The Warden
145.text: I'm sure you do. Alas, I am not quite convinced. Perhaps a small donation would help.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Actually, never mind. I'll leave the prisoners be.

159.speaker: The Warden
159.context: NodeContext: Dismissive glance, nearly shooing them away

58.speaker: Player
58.text: You must confiscate lots of interesting things from prisoners.

25.speaker: The Warden
25.text: Indeed, but all are kept out of reach and under constant surveillance in the office above. Prison security is my highest priority.
25.context: NodeContext: gravely serious, with a note of pride

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *Your mind swirls with information about the prison: the small levers behind the Warden's desk open every cell, while the larger one triggers the alarm.*

148.speaker: Narrator
148.text: *And interesting items confiscated from prisoners lie above the Warden's office, just up the ladder.*

156.speaker: The Warden
156.text: If you are going to stare, kindly do it elsewhere. As I said - you are free to roam where you wish, but do not speak to the prisoners.
156.context: NodeContext: annoyed. Dismissing player at 'go on'

107.speaker: The Warden
107.text: Argh. You are no True Soul! I'll kill you, traitor.
107.context: NodeContext: Vicious, about to get into combat?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: And if I do talk to them?

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'll speak to them if I want.

140.speaker: The Warden
140.text: Is someone feeling rebellious, True Soul? Fine. Speak to them if you wish - but when I catch you, and I will catch you.
140.context: NodeContext: smile as she threatens the player

54.speaker: The Warden
54.text: There will be no trial, no jury. I will split you from head to heel - and the Absolute will thank me for it.
54.context: NodeContext: threatening the player - smile as she imagines it

23.speaker: The Warden
23.text: Good day to you, True Soul.

143.speaker: The Warden
143.text: Then you'll get your own cell.

79.speaker: The Warden
79.text: Disciple Balthazar has plans for them - and were I you I would not get in the way.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Do not disrespect me - I am a True Soul.

106.speaker: The Warden
106.text: Oh, dear - does someone think they're important? You are small, True Soul, insignificant, and above all? Replaceable. Do not forget that.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: Not the cheeriest greeting I've ever had.

91.speaker: The Warden
91.text: If you're looking for a soft bed and warm fire, I have a cell that would suit you perfectly.
91.context: NodeContext: saracasm - there is no soft bed and warm fire

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Our people suffered enough in Elturel - only to be locked up here, by one of their own. Aren't you bothered?

114.speaker: The Warden
114.text: Anyone who refutes the Absolute is an enemy of mine, True Soul. You would do well to remember that.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I'm looking for a particular prisoner - Duke Ravengard?

55.speaker: The Warden
55.text: He sounds important, and I'm afraid the mere dregs are the only ones left in my care.
55.context: NodeContext: smirk, thinking of the prisoners she is currently tormenting

101.speaker: The Warden
101.text: Regardless, know this - I am the Warden. The prisoners are my charges, and I answer to Disciple Balthazar himself. Stay on my good side.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Your face is pretty bland too.

103.speaker: The Warden
103.text: My face might be bland, but yours? It is now carved into my memory - forever.

132.speaker: The Warden
132.text: ...My, they are letting all sorts become a True Soul these days.

24.speaker: The Warden
24.text: He is chief advisor to General Ketheric and one of the Absolute's favoured. His necromancy is second only to the General's - it is an honour to serve him.
24.context: NodeContext: immense pride in her voice

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I'll do my utmost to impress you.

59.speaker: The Warden
59.text: A pity you're already failing then.

61.speaker: The Warden
61.text: I am a busy woman, True Soul. What is it?

72.speaker: The Warden
72.text: Farewell, True Soul. Serve Her well.
72.context: NodeContext: knows she'll be killed soon - sounds resigned

153.speaker: The Warden
153.text: The prisoners have escaped - and the blame falls on me. I will be split open, my innards splayed before the eyes of the Absolute.

98.speaker: The Warden
98.context: NodeContext: closes eyes briefly and sighs as she accepts her fate

152.speaker: Player
152.text: You're not bothered that you'll be killed?

13.speaker: The Warden
13.text: But this is no less than what I deserve for failing Her.
13.context: NodeContext: sad, dissapointed in herself, thought she was better

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I'm glad I snuck the prisoners out when I did.

20.speaker: The Warden
20.context: NodeContext: an almost hysterical laugh as the player confesses to helping prisoners escape

51.speaker: The Warden
51.text: The Absolute shines upon me. She tests me - then She gifts me you. I will now rip you apart - in Her name.
51.context: NodeContext: zealous, relieved - about to attack player

128.speaker: The Warden
128.text: Do not be. It is fitting - I failed her. Try not to do the same.
128.context: NodeContext: resigned, sad, a small spark of concern for the player
